g.text: Crash Fault Tolerance -> Byzantine Fault Tolerance

text.tspan: A new revenue and capability opportunity for systems integrators:
upgrade customer systems from benign failures to adversarial resilience.

g.text: Assumes nodes are honest when alive
Best inside a single-org trust perimeter
Financial loss through fraud and unauthorized actions
Operational disruption, outages, and incident response costs
Compliance exposure and loss of customer trust
Systems are more distributed and more exposed
AI agents and automation expand blast radius
Byzantine fault tolerance is the needed upgrade
when failures can be adversarial, not just accidental.
Tolerates malicious or arbitrary node behavior
Cross-org trust without a single authority
Operate, monitor, and harden BFT deployments (recurring revenue)
F1r3fly enables BFT resilience with crash-fault-like performance, using Rholang, F1r3drive, and CAPs.
Positioning: F1r3fly provides underlying BFT and distributed systems technologies (not a blockchain product).
